summary: The document is a historical record from the DOD Affiliated Personnel and Incident Investigations records series, specifically an identification form for Robert Scheer dated 10/05/66. It details Scheer's personal history, security qualifications, and affiliations with organizations significant for national security. Scheer refused to complete certain sections of the DD Form 398, invoking his constitutional rights under the 1st, 5th, and 14th Amendments. The form underscores the necessity of loyalty and reliability for Armed Forces membership, with extensive inquiries into affiliations and activities.
key_findings: Robert Scheer invoked his constitutional rights to refuse completing parts of the DD Form 398.
The document highlights organizations of interest for national security, including communist and fascist groups.
Scheer's educational background includes The City College of New York and Syracuse University, with employment history at the University of California and City Lights Bookstore.
The form stresses the criteria of loyalty and reliability for Armed Forces membership, focusing on affiliations and activities.
